alert.note: Alert for Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 5:59PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Douglas, Lincoln, central Stevens, Ferry, southeastern Okanogan and northeastern Grant Counties through 645 PM PDT... At 559 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Colville to 14 miles northwest of Davenport to 19 miles northeast of Ritzville. Movement was northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colville, Chewelah, Davenport, Sherman Pass, Lincoln, Kettle Falls, Coulee Dam, Grand Coulee, Odessa, Wilbur, Sprague, Harrington, Elmer City, Creston, Marcus, Mohler, Davis Lake, Addy, Govan, and Cedonia. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 245 and 250. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 212 and 257. U.S. Highway 395 in Washington between mile markers 210 and 252. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Mountains; Okanogan Highlands; Okanogan Valley; Spokane Area; Upper Columbia Basin
